How Meghan Markle celebrates Thanksgiving - and 'what her plans are' this year

The American holiday takes place this year on Thursday, November 22 and many are wondering whether the Duchess of Sussex will be celebrating on the day

View 4 Images This will be Meghan's first Thanksgiving as a royal (Image: PA)

It seems there are two things Meghan Markle loves (other than Prince Harry): A celebration and a chance to get busy in the kitchen - remember that time she baked banana bread on her royal tour of Australia?

‌



Therefore Thanksgiving must be one of her favourite holidays as it allows her to easily combine the two.

‌



The American holiday is celebrated on the fourth Thursday in November, which falls on the 22nd this year, and began hundreds of years ago as a day of giving thanks for the the harvest.

‌



These days, people across the United States mark the occasion by eating a big turkey dinner with all the trimmings while watching either the football or the Macy's parade.

View 4 Images The Duchess loves cooking, so it's possible she could whip up a spread to celebrate the holiday (Image: REX/Shutterstock)

‌



Last year the Duchess of Sussex is believed to have spent the holiday relaxing with her mum, Doria.

It is not yet known whether she will celebrate her first Thanksgiving as a royal, but there are no official 'rules' stopping her from celebrating if she wishes to.

According to Hollywood Life, a close friend of the 37-year-old has claimed that Meghan is in fact planning to host an "American-style" dinner in the Kensington Palace home she shares with Prince Harry.

‌



View 4 Images She's previously revealed how she makes the "perfect" Thanksgiving turkey (Image: Meghan Markle/Instagram)

Meghan Markle will not join Prince Harry on trip to Zambia this month READ MORE :

They said: "Meghan loves being a newlywed and loves spoiling Harry, so she is planning to host an American style Thanksgiving feast and she's going to be making it all from scratch.

"She's an amazing cook and loves making big holiday dinners."

‌



The source added that the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are invited to the meal and Meghan plans to prepare a traditional roast turkey - something the Duchess has previously talked about on her Instagram.

View 4 Images The expectant mum loves celebrating the holidays (Image: Meghan Markle/Instagram)

‌



In 2016, Meghan shared a snap of her "perfect Thanksgiving Turkey", which she cooked on the barbecue instead of in the oven in order to retain as much flavour as possible and create a crispy skin.

As well as this, she has also previously shared several Thanksgiving recipes on her now defunct lifestyle blog, The Tig, including ideas for using up leftovers - one popular one was for turkey tortilla soup.

Do you celebrate Thanksgiving? Let us know in the comments below.
